      • fromHex

        public static byte[] fromHex(java.lang.String hex)
        Parses a hex string in to a byte array.
        Parameters:
        hex - This is handled in a case-insensitive manner. It must consists of only hex chars, not even spaces.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if it contains a non-hex char.

      • unquote

        public static java.lang.String unquote(java.lang.String str)
        Removes surrounding quote chars (" or ') from a string. Any whitespace surrounded by the quote chars are preserved but whitespaces outside of the quote chars are removed. If no quote chars are present the entire string is trimmed of whitespaces. The string is processed adhering to the following rules: - the starting and ending quote chars must be the same. - if the starting or ending quote char is present, the other must also be present, that is, there must be no unmatched quote char. 
         Examples: 
 String s = "  ' hello '  "; // unquote(s) returns "' hello '"
 String s = "  'hello   ";   // unquote(s) will throw an exception
 String s = " hello ";       // unquote(s) returns "hello"
        Parameters:
        str -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if at least one of the rules is violated.

      • parseInt

        public static int parseInt(java.lang.String s)
        Parses integer in a lenient manner, that is, until it encounters a non-digit char.
        Parameters:
        s -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if overflow or underflow.

      • parseVersion

        public static int[] parseVersion(java.lang.String version)
        Parameters:
        version - A version string such as [major].[minor].[revision]
        Returns:
        Non-null. For any part that is non-parsable, a -1 will take its place.
